summary: The confidential report dated 20 July 1962, details information from Jose Ricardo Ratel Ortega, a Cuban national, about the Directorio Revolucionario Estudiantil (DRE)'s activities against the Communist regime in Cuba. It highlights the receipt of 14 tons of arms and munitions by the DRE, the infiltration of explosives experts for sabotage missions, and the anticipation of additional arms and a yacht for operations against the Castro government. The document underscores the importance of secrecy and proposes further engagement with the source to explore operational opportunities or evaluate security risks.
key_findings: The DRE acquired 14 tons of arms and munitions to oppose the Communist regime in Cuba.
Explosives experts were sent to Cuba to conduct sabotage on infrastructure like bridges and railroads.
A forthcoming shipment of arms and a yacht was expected to support actions against the Castro government.
Operations against the Castro government were planned to start within one to two months.
Jose Ricardo Ratel Ortega, with ties to the DRE and Viviendas Campesinas in Cuba, was the informant.
